blog.name: incorrectmarvelcuquotes
blog.title: Incorrect MCU Quotes
blog.description: Totally correct quotes me and my fellow Ravengers, Avengers, Guardians and Asgardians have said. Follow me on twitter!

summary: Bruce: So, there's seven children but only four chairs. What would you do? Thor: Add three more chairs. Loki and Valkyrie: Kill...
body:
Bruce: So, there’s seven children but only four chairs. What would you do?

Thor: Add three more chairs.

Loki and Valkyrie: Kill three children.

Bruce and Thor: …

summary: Thor: I don't think you should be wandering around the townhouse. Hulk: And why is that? Thor: You're not wearing any pants....
body:
Thor: I don’t think you should be wandering around the townhouse.

Hulk: And why is that?

Thor: You’re not wearing any pants.

Hulk: Good point.

summary: Bruce: Did you eat all the donuts? Valkyrie: No. Bruce: I can see the powder on your face. Valkyrie, panicking: That’s just...
body:
Bruce: Did you eat all the donuts?

Valkyrie: No.

Bruce: I can see the powder on your face.

Valkyrie, panicking: That’s just cocaine

summary: I just watched Spiderman: Homecoming and
title: I just watched Spiderman: Homecoming and
body:
I FUCKING LOVED IT

I didn’t get to see it on big screen (my cinema is smol and doesn’t put most of good films, rip Deadpool) I just got to watch it today and it was freaking. Good. I had such a bad day today and it lifted my spirits, made me jump, cry and scream. It was perfect and if you want to know why, let me tell you under the cut. And warning, I have a lot to say.

Also yeah, I’m going to draw a fanart of The Vulture. Because honestly.

This part is “no major spoilers”. There will be also few of my thoughts below with BiG SpoileRS but I’ll give you a warning, don’t worry.

Okay. So. Here are my thoughts.

Spiderman: Homecoming is the best Spiderman movie out of three existing major series at this moment. I’m sure you already heard that, but this film portrays Peter Parker finally in a accurate way. Dorky, “uncool” intelligent guy with a good heart that never shuts up. Tobey Maguire was way too quiet and Andrew Garfield… made this character look like an asshole. I mean it’s the writing’s fault but you get me. Tom Holland is perfect. I’m so glad they actually got a teenager to play a… teenager. His school crush, being the unpopular nerd kid, having nerd friend, it all looked so natural. Even Flash doesn’t get the role of a “I’ll make you hang on your underwear” bully, he is still a bully but in a more reliable way. (unless you really got this kind of treatment in school, in that case I’m sorry.)

Also I love the world building. The stuff that happened in previous movies had an impact on civilians life and we got to see that from the other side. Cleaning up after aliens attack in New York, leftovers from Ultron bots in Sokovia getting in hands of non-federals? Avengers being basically celebrities, Cap being used for making educational movies for kids in schools. I loved it all.

This is a major spoilers part. So even if you are chill with getting some spoilers here and there before watching a film, if you haven’t seen it yet I BEG YOU DON’T READ THE REST. REALLY. IT’S WORTH EXPLORING IT FOR YOURSELF.

Okay then, hello fellow people who also watched this film, how are you.

SO HEAR ME OUT ON THE VULTURE

He is so fresh of a villain. We got really great major villains in few last Marvel movies. (Hela was so aesthetically pleasing, Ultron had a soft spot. It was really subtle and seen in a way he interacted with twins and Black Widow. Ego was great too, tho I was really confused about his great evil plan)  And Vulture is just so human. Yea, he is a villain. We see him shrugging off the fact that he killed a man and caring about the stuff he wants to get instead of worrying that a plane will crash INTO BUILDINGS???

But he also has a strong reasoning behind his decisions. He build the organisation (company? whatever) himself and kept it running, which wasn’t easy. And all of it he did for his family and his workers who also had families. I can totally see his point and thought process that had taken him where he was.

He also has some morals! He made his decisions, most of them were terrible, but he has his priorities straight. He could try to kill Peter the second time after the plane crash, but he was too desperate to get the deliver. And the scene after the end credits when he refused to give up his identity? Because Peter saved his and his daughter’s life? Yes. Thank you. Every other Spiderman movie villain would go straight for the kill and revenge.

And his design is amazing. I’m a fucker for (metal!) wings and pilot jackets.

Peter’s relationship with Tony Stark? People were right. Tony is Peter’s dad. he even makes a joke about it like three times in the movie. 10/10 would dad and son again. I love how Tony just accepted Peter’s decision at the end to give up being an Avenger. Like no big deal, yeah, I designed this brand new suit for you with great care and amount of detail, but you don’t want it yet and that’s absolutely okay. (Btw I am amazed how Tony Stark can make those designs and projects having only 24 hours per day)

Time to talk about the scene that ended my life :).

The one taken from the early issiues of Spiderman comics, where he is trapped under the roof that was dropped on him. The scene in the movie hit me so hard. I did not see this amount of angst coming in an otherwise light hearted movie like this. It got sooo heavy from the big twist point (the villain - hero talk in the car was the best scene in the whole film probably) and this one was a fucking catharsis.

Peter screaming and crying for help, because at that moment he was just a 15 y/o trapped under  huge blocks of concrete, panicing because he was about to die and there was noone who could possibly help him. There was no Iron Man Ex Machina this time. And when he realised that, and realised that he still is a spiderman, even if not in his suit and with sheer force of will ge got out from under the rubble, it was so powerful. I was crying. Do not do this to my son ever again (I didn’t watched the Infinity War yet and fromwhat I heard, I will cry)

OKAY SO I THINK THATS ALL. JESUS I TALK A LOT. SORRY NOT SORRY. I JUST LOVE THIS FILM AND I LIKE TALKING ABOUT THE STUFF THAT EXCITE ME. OKAY BYE.

This part is “no major spoilers”. There will be also few of my thoughts below with BiG SpoileRS but I’ll give you a warning, don’t worry.

Okay. So. Here are my thoughts.

I mean it’s the writing’s fault but you get me. Tom Holland is perfect. I’m so glad they actually got a teenager to play a… teenager. His school crush, being the unpopular nerd kid, having nerd friend, it all looked so natural. Even Flash doesn’t get the role of a “I’ll make you hang on your underwear” bully, he is still a bully but in a more reliable way. (unless you really got this kind of treatment in school, in that case I’m sorry.)

Also I love the world building. The stuff that happened in previous movies had an impact on civilians life and we got to see that from the other side. Cleaning up after aliens attack in New York, leftovers from Ultron bots in Sokovia getting in hands of non-federals? Avengers being basically celebrities, Cap being used for making educational movies for kids in schools. I loved it all.

This is a major spoilers part. So even if you are chill with getting some spoilers here and there before watching a film, if you haven’t seen it yet I BEG YOU DON’T READ THE REST. REALLY. IT’S WORTH EXPLORING IT FOR YOURSELF.

Okay then, hello fellow people who also watched this film, how are you.

SO HEAR ME OUT ON THE VULTURE

He is so fresh of a villain. We got really great major villains in few last Marvel movies. (Hela was so aesthetically pleasing, Ultron had a soft spot. It was really subtle and seen in a way he interacted with twins and Black Widow. Ego was great too, tho I was really confused about his great evil plan)  And Vulture is just so human. Yea, he is a villain. We see him shrugging off the fact that he killed a man and caring about the stuff he wants to get instead of worrying that a plane will crash INTO BUILDINGS???

But he also has a strong reasoning behind his decisions. He build the organisation (company? whatever) himself and kept it running, which wasn’t easy. And all of it he did for his family and his workers who also had families. I can totally see his point and thought process that had taken him where he was.

He also has some morals! He made his decisions, most of them were terrible, but he has his priorities straight. He could try to kill Peter the second time after the plane crash, but he was too desperate to get the deliver. And the scene after the end credits when he refused to give up his identity? Because Peter saved his and his daughter’s life? Yes. Thank you. Every other Spiderman movie villain would go straight for the kill and revenge.

And his design is amazing. I’m a fucker for (metal!) wings and pilot jackets.

Peter’s relationship with Tony Stark? People were right. Tony is Peter’s dad. he even makes a joke about it like three times in the movie. 10/10 would dad and son again. I love how Tony just accepted Peter’s decision at the end to give up being an Avenger. Like no big deal, yeah, I designed this brand new suit for you with great care and amount of detail, but you don’t want it yet and that’s absolutely okay. (Btw I am amazed how Tony Stark can make those designs and projects having only 24 hours per day)

Time to talk about the scene that ended my life :).

The one taken from the early issiues of Spiderman comics, where he is trapped under the roof that was dropped on him. The scene in the movie hit me so hard. I did not see this amount of angst coming in an otherwise light hearted movie like this. It got sooo heavy from the big twist point (the villain - hero talk in the car was the best scene in the whole film probably) and this one was a fucking catharsis.

Peter screaming and crying for help, because at that moment he was just a 15 y/o trapped under  huge blocks of concrete, panicing because he was about to die and there was noone who could possibly help him. There was no Iron Man Ex Machina this time. And when he realised that, and realised that he still is a spiderman, even if not in his suit and with sheer force of will ge got out from under the rubble, it was so powerful. I was crying. Do not do this to my son ever again (I didn’t watched the Infinity War yet and fromwhat I heard, I will cry)

OKAY SO I THINK THATS ALL. JESUS I TALK A LOT. SORRY NOT SORRY. I JUST LOVE THIS FILM AND I LIKE TALKING ABOUT THE STUFF THAT EXCITE ME. OKAY BYE.

blog.name: dualredundancy
blog.title: Dual Redundancy
blog.description:
A weekly podcast about television and entertainment news from David Allen, John Berwick and Kyle Bridger. 
Subscribe to us on iTunes! 
http://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/dual-redundancy/id462378352  Be sure to check out our blog too at http://www.dualredundancy.com/

summary: Podcast Episode 216: Kidding Series Premiere and Castle Rock Season 1
title: Podcast Episode 216: Kidding Series Premiere and Castle Rock Season 1
excerpt: In this week's episode David, John and Kyle discuss a pulled YouTube ad for The Nun (1:55) and the demand from Marvel fans for a Captain Marvel trailer (6:10). We also discuss how the song “Scotty Doesn’t Know” saved someone from entering a coma (15:00) and the proposed TV series based on “Hey There Delilah” from the Plain White T’s (19:20). Finally, we review the series premiere of Kidding entitled “Green Means Go” (26:50) and all of season one of Castle Rock including the finale “Romans” (36:45).

summary:
I know some of the character designs in Insomniac's Spider Man are 
pretty hit and miss, but can we just all take a step back...
body:
I know some of the character designs in Insomniac’s Spider Man are pretty hit and miss, but can we just all take a step back and admire just how awesome Vulture’s beak shaped mask is?

This is a guy who commits to his animal motif 100% and I love it.

reblog.comment:
I know some of the character designs in Insomniac’s Spider Man are pretty hit and miss, but can we just all take a step back and admire just how awesome Vulture’s beak shaped mask is?

This is a guy who commits to his animal motif 100% and I love it.

trail.content_raw:
I know some of the character designs in Insomniac’s Spider Man are pretty hit and miss, but can we just all take a step back and admire just how awesome Vulture’s beak shaped mask is?

This is a guy who commits to his animal motif 100% and I love it.
trail.content:
I know some of the character designs in Insomniac’s Spider Man are pretty hit and miss, but can we just all take a step back and admire just how awesome Vulture’s beak shaped mask is?

This is a guy who commits to his animal motif 100% and I love it.
